title: Need help creating a champion pool, mid lane issues
body:
Hi all I would love your opinion on my issue.

I'm working on creating my champion pool but am struggling to find champions that work in the current meta mid lane. I'm set in all other lanes

I'm not great at assassins or mages and love all in chaps like J4, Maokai and Sejuani.

What champions would you recommend for mid? Or do I have to bite the bullet and learn assassin champions?

Thanks for your help.

replies.body: Swain, vlad can be the kind of champs that hang around and fuck shit up while soaking damage for the team. Tbh you could roam maokai pretty effectively. If you really need some big damage while feeling like you're 'all in' on a fight, look at kennen. Galio scales with MR and does SUPER well against anyone with a DOT (malz, brand, nexus turret :p) but is generally a good pick against AP mids and has that all in tank feel. You could even run revive karthus ðŸ˜‚

THAT IS NOT FUNNY!!!

RIP revive :'(

yasuo is actually a fighter, so you can give him a try, he is great at killing non mobile/skill shot/squishy champs, while also being able to soak a decent amount of damage and dishing out a lot. Talon can also be build a little tanky and melt things regardless, he works well with around 300+ ad a black cleaver + last whisper then you can go tanky (I build {{item:3074}} {{item:3142}} {{item:1326}} {{item:3071}} {{item:3035}} {{item:3072}}) (but {{item:3074}}  {{item:3071}} {{item:3072}} {{item:3035}} then boots and something tanky also work).

Lissandra and Diana have the option to go in similar to the champs you listed. They can both survive for a while in team fights especially when you build them RoA. They have some decent cc similar to j4s ult (in that they are circles around them).
Orianna if you can handle the mechanics.

just play j4 mid 
i have great success with it against low mobi mages and other ad assassin mids
however im just out of bronze where everything works if your better

Swain goes alright if you just love standing in the thick of a fight and tanking, Galio does this job decently too and can hold his own against most of the meta picks, and catching 3 or 4 members of the enemy team in a Galio ult can be devastating.

If you're having trouble laning then Karthus is a relatively safe farming mid laner with Q and he scales fantastically into late game. Lux is a very safe and low skill floor mid laner who is fantastic in the current meta, she scales hard late game and is still a serviceable lane bully early game. Veigar is again a very low skillcap mid laner with great zone control from his E and massive AoE damage from W, he can use Q to farm into late game and has decent sustain from his passive. Brand is on the verge of breaking out as a dominant mid laner because his passive applies Rylai's Crystal Scepter and Luden's Echo, effectively giving him a 5 second slow that can also potentially be AoE, to put it short, he's just insane with items. Ahri is just really safe and has boatloads of mobility and a great CC spell in charm. Vel'koz is a great champion with large amounts of CC for a mage, in addition his passive gives him true damage and his damage is insane, he is a serviceable lane bully but is harder than the aforementioned champions.

Gangplank is kind of a flex pick and is quite hard to play effectively but when played well he is great against squishy immobile mages since he can cleanse their CC spells with W, walk up to their face and bully them hard, his barrels give him a lot of damage and his passive lets him stick to these mages easily but he does get bullied quite easily until level 3 and he is melee.

if you want mid but don't want to be assassin try Yasuo since he is a fighter champion.

But I would recommend a more AP mage such as: Orianna, Azir, Twisted Fate.

also the AD assassins such as Talon and Zed.

Although if you want tank mid Cho'Gath is quite good.
Ahri is basically all you'll ever need. Not even exaggerating.
